p: Experiment diets were generated by using 0.25%, 0.50%, 1% and 1.5% NO. A non-NO-supplemented control diet was prepared, and chemical composition of test diets analyzed using [ 15] guidelines ( Table 1). The dry ingredients for the diet preparation weremixed in a laboratory food blender. To provide a suitable pulp, the mixtures were primed with tap water. The wet materials were used to make 1-mm pellets, which were then dried at 40 °C in a drying cabinet and kept at −20 °C before feeding.
